mods

Class WiFiFinger

  • java.lang.Object
    • mods.AbstractMod
      • mods.WiFiFinger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Emulateable

    public class WiFiFinger
extends AbstractMod
implements Emulateable
    Author:
    arno This module implements NNSS, direct/indirect kNNSS and also performes linear/squares approximations on these data.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  WiFiFinger.WiFiInfo
      This class represents a scan result for a certain timestamp or Environmental Node.
      static class  WiFiFinger.WiFiMethod
      This enum defines methods of the Wii-Fingerprinting for estimating the position - NNSS is the standard next Neighbor in Signal Space (return vector of (0..,0,1,0..0) - direct kNNSS is the direct (fast) k NNSS method that detects the k nearest neighbors and returns them in the probaility vector - indirect kNNSS is like direct kNNSS but additionally the k best map points are computed matching the fingerprints (See figure in thesis)

    • Field Detail

      • sensors

        private final Sensor[] sensors
        This Mod will use static sensor Set

      • signalSpace

        private java.util.Set<java.lang.String> signalSpace
        To give a reliable estimate on the distance in Signal Space there is need for cnstant dimensions of the signal space. This is realized by storing all known BSSIDs in this set.

      • mapFingers

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,WiFiFinger.WiFiInfo> mapFingers
        This HashMap stores the complete amount of WiFiFingerprints for the actual map that are available (K,V) == (NodeID, WIFiInfo-Object)

      • wiFiScans

        private java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Long,WiFiFinger.WiFiInfo> wiFiScans
        This HashMap stores all the scan Results during the walk. (K,V) = (TimeStamp, WiFiInfo-Object)

        Denotes the Method of computing the location (see enum WiFiMethod)

      • readScanFile

        private void readScanFile(java.io.File fScans)
        Reads the scanFile of wifi from the dCollector. Syntax of theFile is: { Time passed (ms): #TIMESTAMP {#SSID: (..) BSSID: {#BSSID}, (..) level: #LEVEL, (..)} ^* } ^* BSSID, level and Timestamp will be taken for this system
        Parameters:
        fScans - the File containing the scans in this declared formatting

      • readFingerFile

        private void readFingerFile(java.io.File wFile)
        Reads the FingerFile and stores is
        Parameters:
        wFile - actual FingerFile

        Returns:
        true in any case...

      • getEstimates

        public LocationEstimationVector getEstimates(long timeStamp1,
                                    long timeStamp2)
        Description copied from interface: Emulateable
        Returns estimates on the Position of the user/device ! The mod itself has to decide if an entry of its data may fit better to the actual or next timestamp ! For example dataTimeStamp = 80, timeStamp1 = 1, timeStamp2 = 81 -> Should decide that dataTimeStamp is not used in most cases.
        Specified by:
        getEstimates in interface Emulateable
        Parameters:
        timeStamp1 - the actual concerning TimeStamp (FP-based)
        timeStamp2 - the upcoming TimeStamp (FP-Based)
        Returns:
        Estimates of the position

      • getkNNSSAccuracy

        private int getkNNSSAccuracy(java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Integer> distances,
                   BiMap.MyEntry<java.lang.Integer> targetPosition)
        Computes the Accuracy when using kNNSS
        Parameters:
        distances - A Map of sorted distances<->NodeIDs
        targetPosition - in case of indirectkNNSS provide the computed GPS-Coordinate
        Returns:
        the accuracy of this estimate (in terms of mean cm-distance to a neighbor)
